description: horse +‎ power: the unit was originally defined as the amount of power that a horse could provide.

nouns.description: horsepower (countable and uncountable, plural horsepowers or horsepower)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) Power derived from the motion of a horse.
examples: The wheel was to have been turned by horsepower, but it was adapted to be driven by a mill-wheel on the river Derwent  […]

entries.meaning: A nonmetric unit of power (symbol hp) with various definitions, for different applications. The most common of them is probably the mechanical horsepower, approximately equal to 745.7 watts.
examples: In the past, before the widespread adoption of SI units, the work that engines were capable of doing was compared with the work that horses could do – hence the term ‘horsepower’. Various people came up with various equivalencies, but the modern agreed definition is that 1 horsepower is 746 joules per second or 746 watts.

entries.meaning: A metric unit (symbol often PS from the German abbreviation), approximately equal to 735.5 watts.
